Table

  • Usage guidelines
  • Basic table
  • Sortable columns
  • Hover rows
  • Row status
  • Icon status
  • Responsive table
  • Mobile layout

Usage Guidelines

In its most basic definition a table is an ordered listing of data in which each of the properties for an individual record (row) are given their own segment (column). This is especially useful for comparing large sets of data across records or segments.

Do

  • Compare data sets or specific values across data records
  • Display all properties or attributes of a data set as well as their explicit values
  • Provide an exhaustive listing of all data
  • View and edit a complete or semi-complete set of objects/entities

Don't

  • Use for viewing relational data across data sets
  • Guide the user to a specific conclusion with data

Basic table

Adding the base .table class adds the basic table styling, such as headers, padding, alternating row striping, etc.

Table Header

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English Action
Germany Berlin 81 million German Action
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish Action

Sortable columns

Add .table-sortable to your table to show that it can be sorted by clicking on one of the column headings.

Your application JS will need to add the class .table-sorted class, along with .table-sorted-ascend or .table-sorted-descend, depending on which direction the table has been sorted.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English Action
Germany Berlin 81 million German Action
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish Action

Hover rows

When an entire row can be selected for an action, add the .table-hover class to the table to highlight rows on hover.

If you want to make a row stay highlighted on click, just use some JavaScript to add the .table-active class to the desired row.

 Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English Action
Germany Berlin 81 million German Action
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish Action

Row status

Styling options are available to highlight data to indicate status or draw attention to some needed action.

Project ID Company Status
16460625-4466 Ornare Associates Complete
16150818-7240 Vulputate Posuere PC On plan
16570222-9922 Felis Nulla Tempor Ltd At risk
16600108-0339 Mattis LLP Overdue

Icon status

Icons within the data set can also be used to highlight row status.

Project ID Company Status
16460625-4466 Ornare Associates Complete
16150818-7240 Vulputate Posuere PC On plan
16570222-9922 Felis Nulla Tempor Ltd At risk
16600108-0339 Mattis LLP Overdue

Responsive table

Wrapping your table with .table-responsive allows the table to scroll sideways when it runs out of space, like on a phone or other small viewport.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English Action
Germany Berlin 81 million German Action
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish Action

Mobile-only pattern

The example below is not responsive. To use it in a responsive application, you will need to have two tables on the page and use the responsive visibility classes to show and hide each as needed.

Mobile layout

When displaying tables on small screens, you can use definition lists to repeat column headings in each cell.
